quotes.quote: Do everything with a mind that lets go. Do not expect any praise or reward. If you let go a little, you will have a little peace. If you let go a lot, you will have a lot of peace.
If you let go a little, you will have a little happiness. If you let go a lot, you will have a lot of happiness. If you let go completely, you will be free.
The Buddha's teachings are about letting go of all suffering. If you don't let go, you will be like a cat trying to catch its own tail.
The present moment is the only moment available to us, and it is the doorway to all moments.
Meditation is not about attaining anything. It is simply a matter of being aware of what is already there, allowing it to be and then releasing it.
The path to peace is through understanding, not through force.
If you are afraid of something, you must face it directly, but with compassion, intelligence, and a sense of humor.
Life is uncertain, death is certain. Knowing this, how can we feel anything but joy?
The mind that is attached to the senses leads to suffering, but the mind that is detached from the senses leads to liberation.
The Buddha's path is not about becoming someone else, but about finding your true nature and living from that place.
The mind creates the abyss, the heart crosses it.
The problem is not the problem; the problem is your attitude to the problem.
Meditation is the process of understanding oneself.
If we attach to criticism, we're stuck with criticism. If we attach to praise, we're stuck with praise.
The Buddha taught that the source of suffering lies in our attachment to impermanent things.
Awareness is not something you can possess, but it is something you can cultivate.
The present moment is the only time we have access to reality.
The more you understand yourself, the more clarity there is. Self-knowledge has no end.
Peace is not the absence of conflict but the ability to handle conflict by peaceful means.
Suffering is a noble truth because it leads to awakening.
